Sub: “Wearing of Anklets by ASG personnel while performing
duty in the periperial area : Reg”

As per the mandate at the airports, perimeter security is very vital in
the protection of the airport. The peripheral area normally remains heavily
vegetated by wild vegetation, creepers, trees etc. Due to the peripheral area
being very vast, it also becomes the shelter for snakes, worms, scorpions
etc., some of which are poisonous and may pose a threat to the life of
security personnel performing duties in the peripheral area.

2. — Thus, it is felt necessary that ASG personnel must wear anklets while
performing duties in the peripheral duty posts in all the shifts. Duty
personnel deployed at these duty posts may also wear DM/Jungle boots
based on the terrain or gum boots, in the rainy season.

3 All CASOs are directed to brief ASG personnel accordingly and ensure
compliance of the above mentioned directions meticulously.

4. Zonal DisG/AP should ensure implementation of the above directions
by the CASOs under their jurisdiction and personally verify the same during

their inspections/visits to airports.
